title: Who's your favorite ARURF champion?
body:
There's a lot of negativity on the boards about ARURF, so let's focus on what is fun with the game mode instead.

Who's your favorite champion so far? 
For me the most fun I've had in league in a long time was playing these in URF
{{champion:427}} {{champion:432}} {{champion:136}} {{champion:163}} {{champion:223}} {{champion:19}}

replies.body: Well. I would say I have a favorite champ, it's Talon.. but I truly never get to play him. I've had the luck of playing him once, and since then either I wouldn't get the luck of rolling him, a team mate won't trade with me, or someone dodges when I get him. Regardless.. RAKE for days y'know?

Probably Leona. Roughly 1.5 sec on her Q is devastating.

{{champion:51}}

things with reliable damag + utility combos are best in ARURF, in other words "low risk, high reward" or champs that can function so good with just 1 or 2 spells like {{champion:126}} {{champion:54}} 

my favs are {{champion:28}}{{champion:80}}{{champion:114}}{{champion:245}}{{champion:5}} {{champion:23}} {{champion:24}}   cuz i love cheese.

this topic makes me sad because I never get to play the champions I'm about to list:

karthus
garen
ww
rammus

Sivir is pretty fun. 

I also like Draven, as I don't even have to pay attention to catching axes anymore. 

I haven't been able to get bard yet, but he also seems like fun; super trolly. 

WW seems like he'll be hard to lvl up in the laning phase, probably just take him in the jungle till six or something. 

I've been wanting to try Urgot, but no luck. Although, I don't really play all that much, so that's expected.

WW -> Start Q,and heal poke on minions. Once you get level 2,you can try to fight with your E. At 6,enemies lose.

Urgod -> OP OP

Well due to the circumstances of URF and how abilities can be abused, I can see the fun chamions also being the hated ones haha... here at some champs I found to be just crazy!

{{champion:28}} {{champion:126}} {{champion:90}}
Back before tryharding became the norm and random replaced the original system, AP Wukong. It sounds stupid, but it was actually ridiculously fun, and a huge counter to Blitz
